definition: extemporaneous thoughts noted down after a visit
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: A great poet once wrote an extempore poem here.
sentences.chinese: 诗人曾经在这里留题了一首诗。

sentences.english: The picturesque view here is a great attraction to me.

definition: to inscribe a poem (often, composed on the spot) on a painting, fan or ceramic bowl etc as a work of calligraphy/an inscribed poem
interpreting words/to explain the meaning of words in classic texts/to decipher an old script
a record of events inscribed on a tablet
rock carving/cliff engraving/words carved into cliff face
couplet (hung on the columns of a hall)
place one has previously visited/old haunts
